trans-unit.source: Insert Or Replace Entity
trans-unit.target: Insert Or Replace Entity

trans-unit.source: Insert Or Replace Entity
trans-unit.target: Insert Or Replace Entity

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation replaces an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation replaces an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.

trans-unit.source: Because this operation can insert or update an entity, it is also known as an <newTerm>upsert</newTerm> operation.
trans-unit.target: Because this operation can insert or update an entity, it is also known as an <newTerm>upsert</newTerm> operation.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace the following values with your own:
trans-unit.target: Replace the following values with your own:

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>myaccount</parameterReference> with the name of your storage account
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>myaccount</parameterReference> with the name of your storage account

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>mytable</parameterReference> with the name of your table
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>mytable</parameterReference> with the name of your table

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>myPartitionKey</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>myRowKey</parameterReference> with the name of the partition key and row key for entity to be updated
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>myPartitionKey</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>myRowKey</parameterReference> with the name of the partition key and row key for entity to be updated

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Emulated Storage Service
trans-unit.target: Emulated Storage Service

trans-unit.source: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Table service port as 127.0.0.1:10002, followed by the emulated storage account name.
trans-unit.target: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Table service port as 127.0.0.1:10002, followed by the emulated storage account name.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: The Table service in the storage emulator differs from the Windows® Azure™ Table service in several ways.
trans-unit.target: The Table service in the storage emulator differs from the Windows® Azure™ Table service in several ways.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c60f2090-c0f4-4817-8559-e98786461dbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Differences Between the Storage Emulator and Azure Storage Services</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c60f2090-c0f4-4817-8559-e98786461dbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Differences Between the Storage Emulator and Azure Storage Services</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.target: Request header

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Required, must be set to 2011-08-18 or newer.
trans-unit.target: Required, must be set to 2011-08-18 or newer.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the content type of the payload.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the content type of the payload.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are <codeInline>application/atom+xml</codeInline> and <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Possible values are <codeInline>application/atom+xml</codeInline> and <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.

trans-unit.target: For more formation about valid content types, see <link xlink:href="9f1dce4a-d528-40ec-a5a4-fd93f9ee4c5e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Payload Format for Table Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The length of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The length of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation sends the entity to be inserted as an OData entity set, which may be either a JSON or an Atom feed.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation sends the entity to be inserted as an OData entity set, which may be either a JSON or an Atom feed.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="8f029e46-f7c1-476a-b349-0649551aa127" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Inserting and Updating Entities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="8f029e46-f7c1-476a-b349-0649551aa127" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Inserting and Updating Entities</link>.

trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 204 (No Content).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 204 (No Content).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link> and <link xlink:href="a34b70ea-3b69-406e-9b1e-660358d997a3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Table Storage Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link> and <link xlink:href="a34b70ea-3b69-406e-9b1e-660358d997a3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Table Storage Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: This operation can be performed by the account owner and by anyone with a shared access signature that has permission to perform this operation.
trans-unit.target: This operation can be performed by the account owner and by anyone with a shared access signature that has permission to perform this operation.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation does not use the If-Match header and it must be called using the 2011-08-18 version or newer.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation does not use the If-Match header and it must be called using the 2011-08-18 version or newer.

trans-unit.source: These attributes distinguish this operation from the <link xlink:href="96a833e2-388c-460c-bfad-11e723c67d3f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Entity</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: These attributes distinguish this operation from the <link xlink:href="96a833e2-388c-460c-bfad-11e723c67d3f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Entity</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is used to replace an entity, any properties from the previous entity will be removed if the new entity does not define them.
trans-unit.target: If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert Or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is used to replace an entity, any properties from the previous entity will be removed if the new entity does not define them.

trans-unit.source: Properties with a null value will also be removed.
trans-unit.target: Properties with a null value will also be removed.

trans-unit.source: When calling the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, you must specify values for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> system properties.
trans-unit.target: When calling the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Insert or Replace Entity</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, you must specify values for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> system properties.

trans-unit.source: Together, these properties form the primary key and must be unique within the table.
trans-unit.target: Together, these properties form the primary key and must be unique within the table.

trans-unit.source: Both the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> values must be string values; each key value may be up to 64 KB in size.
trans-unit.target: Both the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> values must be string values; each key value may be up to 64 KB in size.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an integer value for the key value, you should convert the integer to a fixed-width string, because they are canonically sorted.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an integer value for the key value, you should convert the integer to a fixed-width string, because they are canonically sorted.

trans-unit.source: For example, you should convert the value <codeInline>1</codeInline> to <codeInline>0000001</codeInline> to ensure proper sorting.
trans-unit.target: For example, you should convert the value <codeInline>1</codeInline> to <codeInline>0000001</codeInline> to ensure proper sorting.

trans-unit.source: To explicitly type a property, specify the appropriate OData data type by setting the <languageKeyword>m:type</languageKeyword> attribute within the property definition in the Atom feed.
trans-unit.target: To explicitly type a property, specify the appropriate OData data type by setting the <languageKeyword>m:type</languageKeyword> attribute within the property definition in the Atom feed.

trans-unit.source: For more information about typing properties, see <link xlink:href="8f029e46-f7c1-476a-b349-0649551aa127" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Inserting and Updating Entities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about typing properties, see <link xlink:href="8f029e46-f7c1-476a-b349-0649551aa127" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Inserting and Updating Entities</link>.

trans-unit.source: Any application that can authenticate and send an HTTP PUT request can insert or replace an entity.
trans-unit.target: Any application that can authenticate and send an HTTP PUT request can insert or replace an entity.

trans-unit.source: For information about performing batch upsert operations, see <link xlink:href="b10963c6-ced3-4fcc-abee-58a9e1c2b83a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Performing Entity Group Transactions</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about performing batch upsert operations, see <link xlink:href="b10963c6-ced3-4fcc-abee-58a9e1c2b83a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Performing Entity Group Transactions</link>.
